name: Prima.Pyxis.Accordion

unions.name: Config
unions.comment:
Represents the static configuration of the component. Values
passed in are no more modified by the setter.

unions.name: State
unions.comment:
Internal. Represents the state of the component. Values passed in are
susceptible to change.

values.name: base
values.comment:
Returns the configuration for a Base accordion skin.

    ...

    type alias Slug =
        String

    type Msg =
        Toggled Slug Bool

    ...

    myAccordionConfig : Accordion
    myAccordionConfig =
        Accordion.base "my_accordion_slug" Toggled


    render : Html Msg
    render =
        Accordion.render myAccordionConfig
    ...

values.name: close
values.comment:
Closes the Accordion to hide it's content.

    updatedAccordionState =
        Accordion.close myAccordionState

values.name: dark
values.comment: The same as base but with a Dark skin.

values.name: light
values.comment: The same as base but with a Light skin.

values.name: open
values.comment:
Opens the Accordion to reveal it's content.

    updatedAccordionState =
        Accordion.open myAccordionState

values.name: render
values.comment: Renders the `Accordion`.

values.name: renderGroup
values.comment: Renders a group of Accordion(s) inside an AccordionGroup.
values.type: List.List ( Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.State, Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg ) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: state
values.comment: Returns the basic state of the component.

values.name: withAttribute
values.comment: Adds a generic Html.Attribute to the `Accordion`.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg

values.name: withContent
values.comment: Adds content to the Accordion
values.type: List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg

values.name: withContentClass
values.comment: Adds a class for the content to the `Accordion`.

values.name: withHtmlTitle
values.comment: Adds an Html title to the `Accordion`.
values.type: Html.Html msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Accordion.Config msg

values.name: withSimpleTitle
values.comment: Adds a string title to the `Accordion`.

values.name: withWrapperClass
values.comment: Adds a class for the wrapper to the `Accordion`.

name: Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable

unions.name: AtrDetail
unions.comment:
Represents a detail for an `ATR` which contains information about
the number of accidents in a specific year.

unions.name: State
unions.comment: Defines the configuration of an Atr table

values.name: atr
values.comment:
Creates an empty `AtrDetail`.
Each detail is identified by an year and representation of accidents occurred
during it. All setters methods are pipeable.

values.name: paritaria
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Paritaria value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: paritariaCose
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Paritaria Cose value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: paritariaMista
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Paritaria Mista value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: paritariaPersone
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Paritaria Persone value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: principale
values.comment: Sets the `Responsabilità Principale` value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: principaleCose
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Principale Cose value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: principaleMista
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Principale Mista value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: principalePersone
values.comment: Sets the Responsabilità Principale Persone value for a specific `AtrDetail`.

values.name: render
values.comment: Renders the table by receiving a Configuration. The columns of this table are expressed by the length of the AtrDetail list.

values.name: state
values.comment:
Returns a Tuple containing the Config and a possible batch of side effects to
be managed by parent application. Requires a list of `AtrDetail`.
values.type: Basics.Bool -> List.List Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.AtrDetail -> ( Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.State, Platform.Cmd.Cmd Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.Msg )

values.name: update
values.comment:
Updates the configuration of the Atr table.
Returns a tuple containing the new Config.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.Msg -> Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.State -> ( Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.State, Platform.Cmd.Cmd Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.Msg, List.List Prima.Pyxis.AtrTable.AtrDetail )

values.name: withClass
values.comment: Adds a class to the `AtrTable`.

name: Prima.Pyxis.Button

values.name: callOut
values.comment:
Create a button with a `callOut` visual weight and a `default size`.

    --

    import Prima.Pyxis.Button as Button

    type Msg =
        Clicked

    ...

    myBtn : Button.Config Msg
    myBtn =
        Button.primary "Click me!"
            |> Button.withOnClick Clicked

values.name: loading
values.comment: Create a button with a `Loading` visual weight and a `default size`.

values.name: primary
values.comment: Create a button with a `Primary` visual weight and a `default size`.

values.name: primaryAlt
values.comment: Create a button with a `Primary Alt` visual weight and a `default size`.

values.name: render
values.comment:
Renders the button by receiving it's configuration.

    --

    import Prima.Pyxis.Button as Button

    type Msg =
        Clicked

    ...

    myBtn : Button.Config Msg
    myBtn =
        Button.callOut "Click me!"
            |> Button.withDisabled False
            |> Button.withOnClick Clicked

    ...

    view : Html Msg
    view =
        Button.render myBtn

name: Prima.Pyxis.Container

unions.name: Config
unions.comment:
Represent the configuration of a `Container`.
This type can't be created directly and is Opaque.
You must use Configuration constructors instead

values.name: column
values.comment: Constructs an empty container with regular sizing and direction column

values.name: columnFluid
values.comment: Constructs an empty container with fluid sizing and direction column

values.name: render
values.comment: Renders the `Container`.

values.name: row
values.comment: Constructs an empty container with regular sizing and direction row

values.name: rowFluid
values.comment: Constructs an empty container with fluid sizing and direction row

values.name: withAccessKey
values.comment: Configuration modifier. Adds withAccessKey attribute on the container

values.name: withAttribute
values.comment:
Configuration modifier.
Adds a generic attribute on the container.
You shouldn't use this if is not strictly necessary
values.type: Html.Attribute msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Container.Config msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Container.Config msg

values.name: withChangeSizeOnLarge
values.comment:
Configuration modifier.
Swap between Medium or Fluid sizing on Large breakpoint

values.name: withChangeSizeOnMedium
values.comment:
Configuration modifier.
Swap between Medium or Fluid sizing on Medium breakpoint

values.name: withChangeSizeOnSmall
values.comment:
Configuration modifier.
Swap between Medium or Fluid sizing on Small breakpoint

values.name: withChangeSizeOnXLarge
values.comment:
Configuration modifier.
Swap between Medium or Fluid sizing on XLarge breakpoint

values.name: withClass
values.comment: Configuration modifier. Adds class attribute on the container

values.name: withClassList
values.comment: Configuration modifier. Adds classList attribute on the container
values.type: List.List ( String.String, Basics.Bool ) -> Prima.Pyxis.Container.Config msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Container.Config msg

values.name: withContent
values.comment:
Adds a child content in your container

    --

    import Prima.Pyxis.Container as Container

    myFancyContainer: Html Msg
    myFancyContainer =
        Container.row
        |> withContent
            [ p [][ text "Some fancy text in your row container]
            , img [ src "my/fancy/image.png" ]
            ]
        |> Container.render
values.type: List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Container.Config msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Container.Config msg

Configuration modifier.
Adds contenteditable attribute on the container

name: Prima.Pyxis.Form

unions.name: FormField
unions.comment: Represent the fields admitted by the `Form`.

unions.name: FormFieldset
unions.comment:
Represents `FormFieldset`.
This is not a one-to-one representation of an html `fieldset` tag.

A `FormFieldset` is made up of a list of list of `FormFields`.
The first list represents the rows of a grid, the latter represents each column of a row.

values.name: autocomplete
values.comment: Transforms an `Autocomplete` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: (Prima.Pyxis.Form.Autocomplete.Msg -> msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Autocomplete.State -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Autocomplete.Autocomplete model -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: checkbox
values.comment: Transforms a `Checkbox` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Checkbox.Checkbox model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: date
values.comment: Transforms a `Date` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Date.Date model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: filterableSelect
values.comment: Transforms an `FilterableSelect` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: (Prima.Pyxis.Form.FilterableSelect.Msg -> msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FilterableSelect.State -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FilterableSelect.FilterableSelect model -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: flag
values.comment: Transforms a `Flag` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.CheckboxFlag.Flag model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: init
values.comment:
Create an instance of a `Form`.
You can specify later which fields will go inside it.

values.name: input
values.comment: Transforms an `Input` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Input.Input model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: inputList
values.comment: Transforms an `Input` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: List.List (Prima.Pyxis.Form.Input.Input model msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: legend
values.comment: Creates a `Legend` for a `FormFieldset`.

values.name: legendWithAppendableHtml
values.comment: Creates a `Legend` with appendable Html.

values.name: legendWithPrependableHtml
values.comment: Creates a `Legend` with prependable Html.

values.name: radio
values.comment: Transforms a `Radio` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Radio.Radio model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: radioButton
values.comment: Transforms a `RadioButton` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.RadioButton.RadioButton model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: radioFlag
values.comment: Transforms a `RadioFlag` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.RadioFlag.RadioFlag model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: render
values.comment: Renders the form with all his fields.
values.type: model -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg -> Html.Html msg

values.name: select
values.comment: Transforms a `Select` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: (Prima.Pyxis.Form.Select.Msg -> msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Select.State -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Select.Select model -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: textArea
values.comment: Transforms a `TextArea` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.TextArea.TextArea model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: withAppendableHtml
values.comment: Adds a list of `Html` to a `FormField`. They will be printed after the component tag and it's wrapper.
values.type: List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: withBeside
values.comment:
Create an instance of a `Form` with standard layout where you have
2 fields in line with 1 label.
You can specify later which fields will go inside it.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg

values.name: withFields
values.comment: Adds a list of field (which represents a row of the `Grid`) to the `Form`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormFieldList model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg

values.name: withFieldsAndLegend
values.comment:
Adds a list of list of field (which represents a list of row of the `Grid`) to the `Form`.
This list will be wrapped inside a fieldset.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Legend msg -> List.List (Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormFieldList model msg) -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.Form model msg

values.name: withLabel
values.comment: Adds a `Label` component into a `FormField`.
values.type: Prima.Pyxis.Form.Label.Label msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.FormField model msg

values.name: withVertical
values.comment:
Create an instance of a `Form` with vertical layout.
You can specify later which fields will go inside it.

values.type: (model -> Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool) -> (Basics.Bool -> msg) -> String.String -> Prima.Pyxis.Form.CheckboxFlag.Flag model msg

values.name: render
values.comment:
## Renders the `Input`.

    import Html
    import Prima.Pyxis.Form.Flag as Flag
    import Prima.Pyxis.Form.Validation as Validation

    ...

    type Msg =
        OnCheck Bool

    type alias Model =
        { privacy: Maybe Bool }

    ...

    view : Html Msg
    view =
        Html.div
            []
            (Flag.flag .privacy OnInput
                |> Input.withValidation (Maybe.andThen validate << .privacy)
            )

    validate : Maybe Bool -> Validation.Type
    validate privacy=
        if isJust privacy then
            Just <| Validation.ErrorWithMessage "Privacy cannot be blank".
        else
            Nothing

    view =

name: Prima.Pyxis.Form.TextArea

values.name: render
values.comment:
## Renders the `TextArea`.

    import Html
    import Prima.Pyxis.Form.TextArea as TextArea
    import Prima.Pyxis.Form.Validation as Validation

    ...

    type Msg =
        OnInput String

    type alias Model =
        { note: Maybe String }

    ...

    view : Html Msg
    view =
        Html.div
            []
            (TextArea.textArea .note OnInput
                |> Input.withClass "my-custom-class"
                |> Input.withValidation (Maybe.andThen validate << .note)
            )

    validate : String -> Validation.Type
    validate str =
        if String.isEmpty str then
            Just <| Validation.ErrorWithMessage "Note is empty".
        else
            Nothing

name: Prima.Pyxis.ListChooser

unions.name: ChooserItem
unions.comment: Represent a single item which can be selected via ListChooser's API.

unions.name: Config
unions.comment: Represent the configuration of the component.

unions.name: Msg
unions.comment: Represents the messages dispatched by the ListChooser Component

unions.name: ViewMode
unions.comment:
Defines the mode in which the list must be shown. It's possible to choose
between the full list of items (`viewModeAll`) or a limited set of items (viewModePartial).
In this case the number of items to be shown is expressed via `shownItems`.

values.name: config
values.comment:
Create the configuration of the ListChooser.

    ...

    myConfig : ListChooser.Config
    myConfig =
        let
            shownItems =
                5

            viewAllLabel =
                "Show all"

            viewPartialLabel =
                "Show first " ++ (String.fromInt shownItems) ++ " elements"
        in
        ListChooser.config shownItems viewAllLabel viewPartialLabel

    ...

values.name: createItem
values.comment:
Creates a representation of a ChooserItem.

    ...

    myItem : ListChooser.ChooserItem
    myItem =
        let
            slug =
                "my_item_slug"

            content =
                "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet."

            isSelected =
                False
        in
        ListChooser.createItem (slug, content, isSelected)

    ...

name: Prima.Pyxis.Modal

unions.name: Config
unions.comment:
Represent the configuration of a `Modal`.
This type can't be created directly and is Opaque.
You must use Configuration constructors instead

values.name: hide
values.comment:
Utility that hides a modal.
If you need to hold modal config in your model you
can avoid visibility state duplication and simply use
this helper in your update to hide the modal when you need


## eg.

    --
    type Msg
        = HideYourModal
        | ShowModal

    type alias Model =
        { ...
        , myModal : Modal.Config Msg
        }

    model: Model
    model =
       { ...
       , myModal = Modal.small False HideYourModal
       }
    ...
    -- Somewhere in your views

    yourModal : Model -> Html Msg
    yourModal { myModal } =
        myModal
            |> Modal.render

    -- Somewhere in your update
    case msg of
        ShowModal ->
            model
                |> showModal
                |> withoutCmds
        HideYourModal ->
            model
                |> hideModal
                |> withoutCmds
     ...

     showModal: Model -> Model
     showModal model =
        { model
            | myModal = Modal.show model.myModal
        }

     hideModal: Model -> Model
     hideModal model =
        { model
             | myModal = Modal.hide model.myModal
        }

values.name: large
values.comment:
Large modal configuration constructor.
Modal by default is printed with a close button on header
Requires initial visibility state, and the event that should be emitted
when user interacts with close button


## eg.

    --
    type Msg
        = HideYourModal

    type alias Model =
        { field1 : FieldType
        , isModalVisible : Bool
        }
    ...
    -- Somewhere in your views

    yourModal : Model -> Html Msg
    yourModal { isModalVisible } =
        Modal.large isModalVisible HideYourModal
            |> Modal.render

Renders the modal config

values.name: show
values.comment:
Utility that shows a modal.
If you need to hold modal config in your model you
can avoid visibility state duplication and simply use
this helper in your update to show the modal when you need


## eg.

    --
    type Msg

    type alias Model =

       }
    ...
    -- Somewhere in your views

    yourModal : Model -> Html Msg
    yourModal { myModal } =
        myModal
            |> Modal.render

    -- Somewhere in your update
    case msg of
        ShowModal ->
            model
                |> showModal
                |> withoutCmds
        HideYourModal ->
            model
                |> hideModal
                |> withoutCmds
     ...

     showModal: Model -> Model
     showModal model =
        { model
            | myModal = Modal.show model.myModal
        }

Small size modal constructor.
Modal by default is printed with a close button on header

values.name: toggle
values.comment:
Utility that toggle modal visibility.
If you need to hold modal config in your model you
can avoid visibility state duplication and simply use
this helper in your update to toggle the modal when you need


## eg.

    --
    type Msg
        = ToggleYourModal

    type alias Model =
        { ...
        , myModal : Modal.Config Msg
        }

    model: Model
    model =
       { ...
       , myModal = Modal.small False HideYourModal
       }
    ...
    -- Somewhere in your views

    yourModal : Model -> Html Msg
    yourModal { myModal } =
        myModal
            |> Modal.render

    -- Somewhere in your update
    case msg of
        ToggleModal ->
            model
                |> toggleModal
                |> withoutCmds
     ...

     toggleModal: Model -> Model
     toggleModal model =
        { model
            | myModal = Modal.toggle model.myModal
        }

name: Prima.Pyxis.Tooltip

values.name: bottom
values.comment: Create a tooltip bottom.

values.name: left
values.comment: Create a tooltip left.

values.name: render
values.comment:
## Renders the `Tooltip`.

    import Html
    import Prima.Pyxis.Tooltip as Tooltip

    ...

    type Msg =
        NoOp

    type alias Model =
        {}

    ...

    view : Html Msg
    view =
        Html.div
            []
            (Tooltip.topConfig []
            |> Tooltip.withClass ""
            )

    validate : String -> Validation.Type
    validate str =
        if String.isEmpty str then
            Just <| Validation.ErrorWithMessage "Username is empty".
        else
            Nothing
